subject: Fashion
title: The Bloomer Movement
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Bloomer Movement.

hook.text: In 1851, Amelia Bloomer published a drawing of women in short skirts over baggy trousers.

buildup.text: Women's rights activists adopted the style. They were tired of dragging 20 pounds of petticoats.

discovery.text: The 'Bloomer costume' freed women to walk, climb stairs, and move without tripping on fabric.

twist.text: The mockery was so savage that even suffragists abandoned bloomers. The cause mattered more than comfort.

climax.text: Bloomers returned decades later as athletic wear. The idea survived even when the movement retreated.

punchline.text: They laughed at bloomers. Women wore pants anyway.

quiz.question: Why did suffragists abandon bloomers despite supporting them?
options: Mockery was so intense it was distracting from the suffrage cause
The fabric was too expensive for working-class women to afford
A new law banned women from wearing trousers in public
